comment: All the quizzes are on Pearson with 3 attempts per quiz and test. Maybe 5 homework assignments. Goes over everything in class. If you fail its on you because she constantly gives out answers and reminds you several times when things are due. Give you "mental health day" to take some quizzes at home. She's super nice and cares a lot about her class.

So, a guy got up, said "I quit" and left class in the middle of a peer review a few classes ago. I honestly feel bad for Dr. Castle, she doesn't deserve the hate she's been getting. She isn't the best teacher, sure, but she's a good enough teacher to keep the class engaged. She's definitely demanding, but it's only to motivate us to do our best.

So last week, Dr. Castle made us permanently switch seats to be in groups for something we'll only be doing for a week or two. I'm sorry, WHAT!? Every other class I've ever had kept our seats for the whole semester, but we could move around to work with others. You shouldn't be forced into something you're not comfortable with, especially groups.

I had her for a class last semester. The content was okay, it was just the way she presented things and led the class that didn't sit well with me. A friend of mine (also in the class) broke down crying one day after class because Dr. Castle insulted her for not talking with others like a "normal person" would. Lots of discussion posts to complete.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is just awful. I took her class last semester, and I wanted to quit after the first week. She demands that you talk with others and calls you out when you don't do whatever she wants. Dr. Castle will make you stand up in front of the entire class just to share a topic. And if you are socially shy, she hates that and makes fun of you.

Lots of lectures, but as long as you participate in class you are basically guaranteed an A. All tests/quizzes were multiple choice, open everything, and had multiple chances to take. One group project that was super easy about a personality quiz result.
Very easy class. Show up, do your online homework, one small group project, get an A.

This class was mainly common sense. There is a midterm and a final (online without lockdown browser). While there was an in class group project, it was basically completion. Dr. Castle wanted to make sure everyone passed her class. While the class was mainly common sense, I learned a lot and would take this class again.

Amazing professor and person. Tests, quizzes, midterm, and final are online and no lockdown browser and there is a group project near the end that is super easy to do. I actually accidentally missed the due date for my final and instead of saying "Oh well" she literally opened it and allowed me to still take it. Don't believe the negative comments.

Not only is this one of the easiest classes I've ever done but the professor is amazing as well. Not only does she make the class interesting for me to show up but also engages with the student very well. Easy Grader and very easy assigments that aren't that time consuming. An easy A in my opinion.
She was awful. It really felt like I was being degraded for not communicating like a "normal" person.
The content of the course was mostly common sense, but the saw she presented it was extremely derogatory toward neurodivergent people. She gave lectures that she told us made people need counseling.
The professor was overall flexible and really considerate of the students. I would definitely suggest her to any new or incoming students getting used to college.

She is an excellent professor. She 100% percent meant it when she said this is the one class you will never have to worry about. You have unlimited attempts on quizzes and 3 attempts on the midterm and final. The class is almost completely based off the textbook and all of the quizzes are in the textbook. If you use her you will not regret it.

She is an amazing teacher and will try to get you to communicate better. You do need to participate in class, but there are open book test and quizzes. You have simple "essays" due. the test may seem hard, but you have many attempts or a long time to finish it. Ask her questions and she will answer or help you.
